search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Beamer (beamer.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: The official pricing page for Beamer can be found at: [https://www.getbeamer.com/pricing](https://www.getbeamer.com/pricing) .

FAQ.
----

What happens if I exceed my plan's limits?

If you exceed the number of MAUs that's included in your plan, you will be automatically upgraded with the additional bundles fitting to your level at a rate of **$50**/month per additional **5,000** MAUs. The owner of the account will receive an email notification when this happens.

What is the difference between internal and external "AND" or “OR” conditions when creating filters?

When building segments, both internal and external filters use the same "AND" or “OR” logic. But, they are presented differently in the interface. Here's a breakdown: **1\. Internal Filters (Grouped):** When you click the "+" icon to add a filter, this action groups the filters internally. This means the filters are treated as a single logical block, where conditions within that group must all be met together. It’s like grouping specific criteria that work hand-in-hand. For example, you can group filters based on post clicks and web visits, so those conditions will be checked as a combined requirement.

![Image 13: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e0df33b1f49bcbff03e49_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.40.55-PM-400x110.png)

**Example:** Suppose you want to create a segment of users who have been active recently. You could group the following conditions:

![Image 14: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e0df396bb9ad52496ee70_Screenshot-2024-10-09-at-4.01.50-PM.png)

In this case, both conditions must be met together. The system will only include users who meet **both** criteria as part of the segment, treating them as a single logical block. **2\. External Filters** When you select "Add Filter", you are adding a new condition that is treated externally. This means the conditions are evaluated separately, and the "AND" or “OR” combines the results from these separate conditions. These filters don't interact as a block but instead apply independently, where all conditions must be true for the segment to work.

![Image 15: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e0df361868ff9e8924d5a_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.41.31-PM-400x103.png)

**Example:** Let’s say you want to create a segment that includes users with specific conditions. You could set the following criteria:

![Image 16: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/img/image-placeholder.svg)

In this example, the first two conditions are grouped internally, meaning both must be true. Additionally, the external condition specifies that the **User ID** must be **1234**. All three conditions must be true for a user to be included in the segment. **In Summary:**

*   **"+" (internal grouping):** Combines filters into a single block where all conditions must be met together.
*   **(External):** Adds filters that are evaluated separately but must still all be true for the segment.

Though the presentation of the filters varies, the "AND" or “OR” logic remains the same for both internal and external filters. To conclude, both the "+" and "Add Filter" options function the same way. The "AND" or "OR" logic works the same whether the filters are grouped internally or added externally. The only difference is how the filters are visually grouped in the interface, but the outcome will remain identical.

How to Customise the Position of the Widget Icon?

You can customise the position of your widget icon in two ways to enhance its placement within your application. Here are two primary methods to achieve this: **1\. Using the Widget Settings Menu**

*   Navigate to the [widget settings](https://app.getbeamer.com/settings#widget) in your Beamer dashboard.
*   In the settings, find the option to select the widget’s position.
*   Click on the dropdown menu to view available position options such as **top**, **bottom**, **left**, and **right**.

![Image 17: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e0eec73a2092a02cc3200_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.29.12-PM-400x208.png)

*   Choose your desired position, and the widget will automatically adjust to the selected placement.

#### **2\. Adjusting the Notification Bubble Offset**

*   Customise the widget's position further through the notification bubble offset settings.
*   Specify precise positioning by entering pixel (PX) values for the widget’s placement.

![Image 18: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e0eedac7fc697f965b374_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.29.45-PM-400x74.png)

*   Modify the **top**, **right**, **bottom**, and **left** values to position the widget exactly where you want it on the screen.
*   This method allows for fine-tuning, ensuring the widget does not interfere with other elements of your application’s UI.

#### **3\. Using Custom CSS**

*   **Local CSS Customization**: You can also customize the widget’s position using your local CSS styles.
*   **Target Widget Elements**: Use CSS selectors to target the widget's elements and apply styles like position, top, left, right, and bottom to adjust its placement according to your design needs.

Why is my post not appearing on the standalone page?

If your post isn't appearing on the standalone page, follow these steps:

1.Ensure you have selected “**standalone”** in the changelog options for your post.

![Image 19: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e103f7839d67d69779b3d_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.19.58-PM-400x186.png)

2.Double-check that the category you've selected for your post is also included in the **standalone categories** list.

![Image 20: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e103f6c7fe6dc13924cd0_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.20.39-PM-400x155.png)

Sometimes, even if you've correctly categorised your post, it may not appear in the standalone page unless that specific category is enabled for standalone display. To verify this:

*   Go to your [**settings**](https://app.getbeamer.com/settings#product) \> [**standalone settings**.](https://app.getbeamer.com/settings#standalone)
*   If the category of your post is not listed there, you'll need to manually add the category to ensure your post gets displayed.

![Image 21: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/670e103fb8ced97b5cf0b721_Screenshot-2024-10-08-at-5.22.36-PM-400x168.png)

If your segmented post is not showing up on the standalone page, please refer to the document linked below: [Why is my segmentation post not appearing on the standalone page?](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/why-is-my-segmentation-post-not-appearing-on-the-standalone-page).

Where Beamer data is saved and what is the data?

By default, all Beamer data is stored in US-based servers and databases. However, Beamer offers the option to migrate end-user data to EU-located servers if that aligns better with your compliance or privacy needs. If you prefer to store data in the EU, simply reach out to Beamer support to make this request. Beamer collects various types of data based on your usage, which include:

*   User interaction data
*   NPS survey responses
*   User segmentation information
*   Any filters you set in the Beamer configuration script

For further details on the specific data collected and how it’s used, you can refer to Beamer’s [Privacy Policy](https://www.getbeamer.com/privacy-policy/#personal-information).

What are the different scores compared to the NPS 10 scale?

When comparing various scoring systems to the traditional NPS (Net Promoter Score) 10-point scale, the scores can be aligned as follows:

### Comparison to NPS 10-Point Scale:

*   **1 on a 1-5 scale** = **2 on a 0-10 scale**
*   **2 on a 1-5 scale** = **4 on a 0-10 scale**
*   **3 on a 1-5 scale** = **7 on a 0-10 scale**
*   **4 on a 1-7 scale** = **9 on a 0-10 scale**
*   **5 on a 1-5 scale** = **10 on a 0-10 scale**

![Image 22: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f6771eeb0748edd741f8a7_Screenshot-2024-09-24-at-10.34.16%25E2%2580%25AFAM-400x175.png)

Similarly, when using alternatives like emojis or a 5-star system, the values get converted accordingly. For instance, if a user selects **3/5 emojis**, this might translate to around **7** on the 0-10 NPS scale.

### 3 Scale Emoji Display Type:

*   **Sad** → **1** (Detractor)
*   **Neutral** → **7** (Neutral)
*   **Happy** → **10** (Promoter)

### NPS Calculation Formula:

*   **Promoters:** Scores of 9-10
*   **Passives/Neutrals:** Scores of 7-8
*   **Detractors:** Scores of 1-6

![Image 23: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f6771e9d8426afea476018_Screenshot-2024-09-24-at-10.35.36%25E2%2580%25AFAM-400x49.png)

### Note on Accuracy:

While converting scores from alternative scales to the NPS 10-point scale can be helpful, the granularity and interpretation may vary, so accuracy may decrease when switching systems.

How do the initial time and delay for NPS gets calculated?

The initial timing for displaying the **NPS** (Net Promoter Score) survey to users can be customized through various settings in your NPS dashboard. Here’s how the timing is calculated and adjusted: **1\. Initial Delay**: Setting: NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> INITIAL DELAY **Description**: The "Initial Delay" setting determines how much time must pass after Beamer first detects a user before the NPS survey is shown to them. The default setting is 30 days, but you can adjust this based on your requirements.

![Image 24: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a9a6be7df53b136a07_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.27.20%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x130.png)

**How It Works**:

*   For example, if the initial delay is set to 60 days, users will only be prompted with the NPS survey after 60 days of being detected by Beamer.
*   If you configure this setting today, Beamer will start counting the delay for new users moving forward. So, users detected today will be eligible for the survey after 60 days.

**2\. Retry Delay (After Rating)**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Retry Delay (After Rating).

![Image 25: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a9bae67ba44932bf9e_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.28.49%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x86.png)

**Description**: This is the delay before showing the prompt again if the user has already rated your site or app. The default setting is 90 days. **3\. Retry Delay (After Closing Prompt)**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Retry Delay (After User Closes the Prompt).

![Image 26: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a9f6b86f3ca7bda8fd_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.29.51%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x71.png)

**Description**: This is the delay before prompting the user again if they close the NPS prompt without providing a rating. The default setting is 14 days. **4\. Delay Before Showing the Prompt**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \>Delay Before Showing the Prompt.

![Image 27: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a9f2787303c06be073_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.31.06%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x106.png)

**Description**: This is the delay in seconds before showing the NPS prompt once it is determined that the user should be prompted (based on the conditions set). It is recommended to set this to no more than 120 seconds. **5\. Delay Before Hiding the Prompt**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Delay Before Hiding the Prompt).

![Image 28: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a9d498dda932aceb78_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.32.05%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x84.png)

**Description**: This is the delay in seconds before hiding the NPS prompt after the user has completed the survey. Setting this to at least 7 seconds is recommended to allow users to read the final message. **6\. Delay Before Sending an Email Survey**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Delay Before Sending an Email Survey.

![Image 29: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a95ffc1997270ded56_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.33.06%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x82.png)

**Description**: This is the delay in days before sending an email survey to users who have seen the NPS survey but still need to complete it. The default setting is 7 days. **7\. Delay Before Re-Sending an Email Survey**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Delay Before Re-Sending an Email Survey.

![Image 30: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a904110b19b0c97407_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.33.58%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x83.png)

**Description**: This is the delay in days before sending another email survey to users who still need to complete the previous email survey. The default setting is 30 days. **8\. Percentage of Users to Prompt**: Setting: Go to NPS Dashboard \> NPS Settings \> Percentage of Users to Prompt.

![Image 31: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f677a935b9059e6b0d533e_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-10.36.11%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x93.png)

**Description**: This is the percentage of users on your site or app who will be shown the NPS prompt. The default setting is 60%. These settings allow you to control the timing and frequency of your NPS survey prompts to optimize user feedback and engagement.

How do I add a user ID to the segment, and is there a maximum limit for segmentation?

The ability to add user IDs and create segments is available for users on the **Scale plan** and higher.

How to Add a User ID to a Segment
---------------------------------

*   Go to the **Users tab**: [Beamer Users](https://app.getbeamer.com/users).
*   Use the filters to create segments based on specific criteria, including **user ID**. Add a semicolon between user IDs to include multiple user IDs.

![Image 32: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67916e6be8252fd97a9d7_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.21.11-PM-400x134.png)

*   You can filter by:
    *   **is**: The field must exactly match the specified value.
    *   **is not**: The field must not match the specified value.
    *   **contains**: The field must include the specified value.
    *   **does not contain**: The field must exclude the specified value.
    *   **has any value**: The field must have any value, regardless of what it is.
    *   **is unknown**: The field must be empty or undefined.

![Image 33: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67916eed2f1503a787bcd_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.21.48-PM-400x305.png)

*   Choose between **OR** or **AND** operators to refine your segment based on multiple conditions.

**Note:** You can segment an unlimited number of filters based on your criteria. **Save Segment Feature** You can also create **preset filters** by using the **Save Segment** feature in Beamer. Here's how: After setting up your desired filters to segment users:

*   Click on the **Save Segment** option to store that filter configuration.

![Image 34: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67916afa0960f3ef5ebf6_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.32.23-PM.png)

*   You can give the segment a name, making it easy to reuse later.

![Image 35: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67916c1a40f9371c80879_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.34.41-PM-400x160.png)

*   These segments can later be viewed and managed easily from the left-hand panel under the **Segments** section.

![Image 36: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67915d7bdc2a632a214e3_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.35.22-PM-400x382.png)

*    **Note:** When using filters, be aware of the following character support:
    *   **Supported Characters**: Letters (A-Z, a-z), Numbers (0-9), and symbols (commas, underscores).
    *   **Not Supported**: Special characters like apostrophes ('), quotation marks ("), and some other punctuation marks may not be supported in filters.

How to Change the Header Name?

Beamer limits media file uploads (including GIFs, images, and videos) to **10 MB** for optimal performance. If your file exceeds this size, you’ll need to reduce the size before uploading. To ensure fast load times and a smooth experience for your users, we recommend using smaller file sizes or compressing large files. If your media still exceeds the limit, consider hosting it externally (e.g., YouTube for videos) and embedding the link in your post.To change the header name of your notification, follow these steps: Step 1: Navigate to the **Settings** menu. Step 2: Select [**Languages**](https://app.getbeamer.com/settings#languages) from the settings options. Step 3: Under **Texts & Translations**, find the section labeled **Announcements**.

![Image 37: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67c87efc335e6437fdf46_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.23.46%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x65.png)

Step 4: Look for the default text, _"What's new on"_. There will be a text box underneath where you can change this default header to anything you prefer.

![Image 38: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67c87d01a519703e02dd7_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.26.36%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x116.png)

How to Change Website Name?

To change the website name that appears in the top bar and sidebar menu, follow these steps: Step 1: Go to [**Settings**](https://app.getbeamer.com/settings)**.** Step 2: Access **General Settings.** Step 3: Change **Website Name.**

![Image 39: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67d0cb7e441f2af447e52_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.15.41%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x186.png)

The updated website name will be reflected in the top bar and sidebar menu, such as in the text "What's New on {website name}".

![Image 40: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67d0d9d8654451f86e280_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.17.03%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x69.png)

Step 4: Users can change the subtitle from **the Website Description.** Step 5: Click **“Save Settings”** to implement your changes.

![Image 41: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67d0c32755936baf0f8c8_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.18.52%25E2%2580%25AFPM.png)

**Note:** Once the website name is changed it will show up in Ideas as {Website Name} Ideas and Roadmap tab as {Website Name} roadmap.  Ideas:

![Image 42: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67d0cc839da198fa0ba22_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.19.38%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x73.png)

Roadmap:

![Image 43: summary image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66b70736e94ee47108b9f364/66f67d0d3d658e4600a024d9_Screenshot-2024-09-23-at-9.20.09%25E2%2580%25AFPM-400x73.png)

How are segments combined in Beamer? Can I use AND and OR?

In Beamer, **segmentation** allows you to target specific users with posts, ensuring that the content is relevant to the audience you want to reach. As of now, Beamer supports two types of segmentation:

*   Basic segmentation
*   Advanced segmentation

**Basic Segmentation (Default OR Condition):** Basic segmentation allows you to display specific Beamer posts to users by passing segment values in the filter parameter of your Beamer embed code.  It operates by default using the OR condition. This means: If you assign multiple segments to a post, the post will be displayed to users who match at least one of the segments. It enables broader targeting, as users only need to meet any one of the criteria. **Note:** Basic segmentation is available from the **PRO** subscription plan only. **How to Create a Basic Segment: 1. Pass segment values in the filter parameter.** In your Beamer embed code, you specify which segments (filters) the current user belongs to by passing them in the filter parameter. **Example Code:**‍

```
<script>
    var beamer_config = {
        product_id: "YOUR_PRODUCT_ID", // Replace with your Beamer product 
        IDfilter: "admin;test", // Replace with the user's segments
    };
</script>
<script src="https://app.getbeamer.com/js/beamer-embed.js" defer></script>‍
```

Replace **YOUR\_PRODUCT\_ID** with your actual product ID. Replace **"admin;test"** with the segments applicable to the current user, separated by semicolons **;** For detailed instructions, please refer to our guide: [How to Use Segmentation](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-use-segmentation)**Select Segments in Posts:** When creating or editing a post in the Beamer dashboard: 1.Go to the Post Editor: 2.Click on "Create Post" 3.Assign Segments to the Post: 4.In the "Segment filters" field, enter the segments you want to assign to the post. **Example:** Type **admin;test** to assign both segments to the post. **Note**: Use semicolons **;** to separate multiple segments. **Assigning segments in the post editor:** When creating or editing a post in your Beamer dashboard, you can assign one or more segments to it. **Example**: Assign the segments admin and test to a post. **Understanding the OR Condition:Multiple Segments:** If you assign multiple segments to a post (e.g., admin and test), users who match any of those segments will see the post. **Example:**

*   A user with the admin segment will see the post.
*   A user with the test segment will also see the post.
*   A user with both admin and test segments will see the post.

This OR condition ensures that your content reaches a broader audience who meet at least one of the criteria. **Advanced Segmentation (AND & OR):** Advanced Segmentation allows you to create complex segments directly in Beamer using your user data. It supports both AND and OR conditions, enabling you to target users who meet specific combinations of criteria. **Features:**

*   **Create Segments from User Attributes:** Use standard and custom user attributes to build segments.
*   **Combine filters with AND/OR logic:** define precise targeting conditions.
*   **Ideal for precise targeting:** Reach specific user groups based on detailed criteria.

**Note**: Advanced Segmentation is available in the **Scale and Custom** subscription plans. Access the Users Tab. Click on Users create segmentation, and add filters or pass custom user attributes via script. For more details, please check out our comprehensive guide: Advanced Segmentation Guide – Custom User Attributes »

How do two boosted announcements work?

If you have two boosted announcements scheduled at the same time, only the most recent announcement will be displayed to your users. If you publish or update two boosted notifications or two updates together, the newer one will replace the older one. The older announcement will no longer appear, as Beamer prioritises displaying the latest content to ensure users see the most up-to-date information. This way, only the recent boosted announcement or update gets shown to users, preventing them from being overwhelmed by multiple announcements at once.

What happens if I edit/republish a post?

When you edit or update an already published post in Beamer, no new notifications—such as email or push notifications—will not be triggered again. These notifications are sent only once when the post is first published. However, the in-app notifications and boosted announcements (such as **Topbar**, **Popup**, **Snippet**, and **Tooltip**) will reflect the updated content in real time for users who have not yet seen the post. This will allow users to still see the latest version without being overwhelmed by multiple notifications for the same post

What is the maximum size for uploading media files?

Beamer limits media file uploads (including GIFs, images, and videos) to **10 MB** for optimal performance. If your file exceeds this size, you’ll need to reduce the size before uploading. To ensure fast load times and a smooth experience for your users, we recommend using smaller file sizes or compressing large files. If your media still exceeds the limit, consider hosting it externally (e.g., YouTube for videos) and embedding the link in your post.

How much does User Onboarding cost?

User Onboarding is built and managed by our partner, [Userflow](https://userflow.com/?utm_source=getbeamer.com/pricing&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=faq-cost-homepage). For more information or to start a 14-day free trial, please visit their [pricing](https://userflow.com/pricing?utm_source=getbeamer.com/pricing&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=faq-cost-pricing) page.

Is User Onboarding a Beamer product?

User Onboarding is built and managed by our partner, [Userflow](https://userflow.com/?utm_source=getbeamer.com/pricing&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=faq-product). [Beamer](https://www.getbeamer.com/) and Userflow merged to help SaaS teams unify their customer journeys with a complete toolkit that combines user communication and effective product guidance. Sharing User Onboarding is the first step in this exciting new chapter for Beamer and Userflow.

Is Beamer really free?

[Changelog](https://www.getbeamer.com/changelog), [Feedback](https://www.getbeamer.com/feedback), and [NPS](https://www.getbeamer.com/nps) all have a completely free plan option. You can also mix and match paid products and free products on your Beamer plan depending on your needs. User Onboarding by [Userflow](https://userflow.com/) has a free 14-day trial, no credit card necessary.

What are push notifications?

Push notifications allows you to sends notifications to users that are not currently on your website or app. Users will be shown a customizable opt in prompt and will be able to suscribe to your updates. You can enable push notifications on a post by post basis - ie. you can choose which posts to send push notifications for. These notifications work with Chrome (web and mobile), Firefox, Edge and Opera. Learn [how to get push notifications here](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-get-push-notifications), or [how to enable them here.](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-setup-and-use-push-notifications)

Can I use a Beamer account on multiple websites?

Yes, you can embed the same changelog in multiple accounts or manage multiple changelogs with a single users. The latter option means that you have a single user (email and password) linked to multiple accounts. Each of them will be billed separately and you may have different plans for each one of them. To learn how to create multiple accounts [please read this quick tutorial.](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-manage-multiple-accounts)

What are my payment options?

For [monthly plans](https://www.getbeamer.com/pricing) we accept any major credit card. For yearly plans, payment can be made via **credit card**, **PayPal**, **ACH**, or by **bank transfer** (USA and Europe only).

What is user segmentation?

User segmentation can be used to send targeted messages to specific groups of users. For example, you can show different posts to paying users and non-paying or logged in users and logged out. You can also show different feeds to users based behaviour such as past purchases from your store or which specific page they are visiting on your domain. To activate user segmentation you simply need to tag your users and send these tags through your Beamer script. Learn more in this [guide](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-use-segmentation) or in our [Developer Docs](https://www.getbeamer.com/docs).

How are Monthly Active Users (MAU's) calculated?

**Monthly active users** (MAUs) are calculated as the number of unique users who access any page where Beamer’s script is embedded or on the standalone page in a given month. We don’t charge for inactive users who might be in your database but don’t sign in or visit your website during a given month.

**How do you differentiate unique users?** With Beamer, you have the option to track and process user data using standard parameters like _`user_id`_. This is a unique identification value that will help to track a user even if the other data parameters are changed such as logging on from a different device and ensure that it only counts as a single user, not multiple. We use this _`user_id`_ to count your Monthly Active Users and it can help you understand what your users want and how they interact with your content (views, clicks, feedback, and more). If not, by default, Beamer will rely on a cookie stored in the browser to identify unique users. This approach is less reliable because:

1.  Users can clear their browser’s cookies.
2.  The same user can connect from different browsers/devices and each new device or browser that they access Beamer on will count towards your Monthly Active User count.

You can add additional bundles of **5,000** MAUs at **$50**/month. [**For more information on sending user data to Beamer and how it can help you understand your users better, check out this article.**](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-send-user-data-to-the-beamer-script)

Is there any limit for API requests?

Yes - there is a monthly limit of **2,000 API requests in Starter, 20,000 in Pro and 100,000 in Scale.** If this limit is exceeded additional API requests will be charged at $49 for the first extra block of 100K API requests and $19 / additional 100K blocks after that.

What is Beamer’s privacy policy?

Your privacy is important to us. You can check out our **privacy policy** by clicking on [this link.](https://www.getbeamer.com/privacy-policy)

What are Beamer’s terms of service?

At Beamer we want to offer you transparent and fair terms of service. You can check out **our terms of service** by clicking [on this link.](https://www.getbeamer.com/terms-of-service)

What can you change with appearance customization?

With **appearance customization** you can change Beamer’s style to match your site or app so that Beamer fits perfectly with your design. You can edit header and background color, category colors, font size and more. If you need even more appearance customization you can use [Custom CSS](https://www.getbeamer.com/blog/how-to-use-custom-css-to-personalize-beamers-appearance) (Pro plan only).

What is the difference between basic and advanced analytics?

**Domain whitelist** allows you to restrict which url's your Beamer sidebar can be displayed on. This helps you maintain ultimate control over your Beamer announcements and make sure they are showing up only on the sites you want them to appear. For more info on how this worWhat is the difference between basic and advanced analytics?ks check out [this detailed article in our Help Center.](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-use-domain-whitelist)

What are comments and reactions?

You can [add comments and reactions](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-enable-feedback-and-reactions) to any post which allows users to leave a smiley face reaction or text comments (private, only visible to account admins). **This is a great feature to understand what your users think about your latest updates.**

Can I cancel my subscription?

You can cancel your subscription anytime and your card will not be charged for the following month. **You will not be refunded for prior payments unless there is a problem with your account.**

What is domain whitelist?

**Domain whitelist** allows you to restrict which url's your Beamer sidebar can be displayed on. This helps you maintain ultimate control over your Beamer announcements and make sure they are showing up only on the sites you want them to appear. For more info on how this works check out [this detailed article in our Help Center.](https://www.getbeamer.com/help/how-to-use-domain-whitelist)

Privacy Preference Center

When you visit websites, they may store or retrieve data in your browser. This storage is often necessary for the basic functionality of the website. The storage may be used for marketing, analytics, and personalization of the site, such as storing your preferences. Privacy is important to us, so you have the option of disabling certain types of storage that may not be necessary for the basic functioning of the website. Blocking categories may impact your experience on the website.

Reject all cookies

Allow all cookies

Manage Consent Preferences by Category

Essential

**Always Active**

These items are required to enable basic website functionality.

Marketing

Essential

These items are used to deliver advertising that is more relevant to you and your interests. They may also be used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement and measure the effectiveness of advertising campaigns. Advertising networks usually place them with the website operator’s permission.

Personalization

Essential

These items allow the website to remember choices you make (such as your user name, language, or the region you are in) and provide enhanced, more personal features. For example, a website may provide you with local weather reports or traffic news by storing data about your current location.

Analytics

Essential

These items help the website operator understand how its website performs, how visitors interact with the site, and whether there may be technical issues. This storage type usually doesn’t collect information that identifies a visitor.

Confirm my preferences and close

Beamer pricing is easy, transparent, and flexible. Choose from Free, Starter, PRO or Scale plans. For a Custom plan talk to sales.

pricing_data.pricing_notes: Additional MAUs can be added at a rate of $50/month per 5,000 MAUs.

pricing_tiers.tier_description: Best for small teams. Get started quickly drafting and publishing product communications and company news.
Best for growing teams. Communicate your product velocity and get crucial feedback from your users.
Best for large or rapidly scaling teams. Layer in advanced features like segmentation and user activities to optimize for engagement and adoption.

additional_fees.fee_description: Cost per additional 5,000 Monthly Active Users.
